page.title: 06FOOTPATHS
page.content: There are 25 public footpaths running through our area. The County Council numbers and signposts the paths with the aid of the Ramblers Association. The Speldhurst Parish Footpaths Group checks that paths are maintained by the landowners. Many paths are simply short cuts between various places but some stretch right across our area. One path, Bridleway 111, used to be a packhorse route and may have been a smugglers path from the coast to London. It enters our block at grid ref. 05550138 and runs up a wooded ravine. From the bottom of Barrow Lane over Holmewood Ridge to the cemetry at the end of Farnham Lane the old path has been replaced by a modern road. At the cemetry it becomes a woodland path once more.The path,heading for London, leaves the area at grid ref. 05580410.
